description: As a mentor in the 'Entre Compas' program, my main objective is to provide support and guidance to new students in the Systems Engineering program, sharing the knowledge and skills I have acquired throughout my university journey. I understand that university life can present challenges in terms of time management, balancing studies with other activities, and academic planning. I assist students in setting clear goals, managing their time effectively, and finding the right balance in their student life. My aim is to provide them with the necessary tools and strategies to succeed both in their studies and in their personal development.

Participation as Extension Administrative Assistant of the School of Languages of the University of Antioquia. Doing support activities such as customer service, database management data and working collaboratively with people involved in the area.

In my role as a Frontend Developer on a banking application development project, I collaborated in the creation of web applications using ReactJS, JavaScript, and Tailwind CSS. This experience in the banking project allowed me to develop key skills, such as Frontend development with ReactJS. Furthermore, it improved my ability to work in multidisciplinary teams and adapt to changing project requirements.

As a Frontend Developer, I had the privilege of being part of a highly collaborative team that utilized cutting-edge technologies to develop an innovative classroom session assistance project. During my time in this role, I honed my skills in using Next.js, Tailwind CSS, and TypeScript, and put my knowledge into practice by consuming an API to create a unique solution.

As a Frontend Developer, my primary responsibility was to participate in the development of a sports space reservation project in collaboration with a multidisciplinary team. Over a 5-week period, I utilized a variety of technologies and skills to contribute to the project's success, such as: Frontend development with Next.js, Tailwind CSS, and TypeScript, integration of an API for the web application, teamwork and effective collaboration, assertive and efÔÄÅcient communication, project management using the SCRUM framework.

üìö Subjects: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL and NoSQL Databases, Algorithms and Control Structures, Java SE, Git/GitHub.

What do we do? üåê In this exciting tutoring program, I have the privilege of supporting students at EAFIT University on their programming learning journey. My goal is to help clarify doubts, foster understanding of key concepts, and provide practical guidance in a variety of languages and technologies fundamental in the programming world.

How do I help? üí° My focus is on clarity and accessibility. I work closely with students to identify their challenges and design effective solutions. From problem-solving in algorithms to creating impressive web projects, I'm here to guide and support at every step of the way.
